abstract.p: Letter by Frederick Willman responds to Peter H Lewis's May 25 article on new laptop computers; says he does not share article's enthusiams for new keypad, noting it lacks lacks built-in incline feature

block.p: In his encomium to I.B.M.'s new laptops, Peter H. Lewis includes a hosanna for their keyboards. He singles out the addition of a ThinkLight to illuminate the keyboard in dark rooms and calls it indicative of the company's ''attention to detail.''

I'll buy a laptop when I.B.M. or any other company gets really thoughtful, by designing an inclining keyboard, like that of a desktop, for touch-type writers and editors who want a traveling PC. Until that happens, the flat laptop keyboard decrees both peck-line typing and shoulder and elbow pain.
